holdings.text: Cl. 3 is the accrual clause: the commission became due at the end of each financial year or other period for which the accounts of the Mills Company were to be laid before the General Meeting.

anchor.surface_text: We do not think that this reading of the two clauses is correct. In our view, cl. 3 is the accrual clause it shows that the commission became due at the end of each financial year or other period for which the accounts of the

holdings.reasoning_summary: Contract construction: cl. 3 distinguishes time commission becomes due (accrual) from time payable; rejects accrual per sale under cl. 2.

holdings.text: Cl. 2 determines the rate at which the remuneration is to be calculated; cl. 3 determines the time of accrual and time of payment.

anchor.surface_text: Putting the two clauses side by side, the conclusion at which we have arrived is that in their true scope and effect cl. 2 determines the rate at which the remuneration is to be calculated and as to the time of payment,

holdings.reasoning_summary: Harmonious reading of clauses: cl. 2 for computation basis (rate on gross sales), cl. 3 for accrual (end of year) and payment (after accounts passed).

holdings.text: This view of the managing agency agreement concludes the appeal: remuneration accrued at the end of the financial year to the assessee Company.

anchor.surface_text: This view of the managing agency agreement of March 15, 1925, concludes the appeal. If the remuneration accrued at the end of the financial year, then undoubtedly it accrued in the hands of the assessee Company.

holdings.reasoning_summary: Construction of agreement shows accrual to assessee as entitled from April 1, 1944; resolves whether commission April-Dec 1944 accrued to Nemani or assessee.

holdings.text: The decision in Sassoon's case applies: real point is when remuneration accrued, regardless of basis (profits or sales).

anchor.surface_text: As to the decision in Sassoons case it is pointed out that the commission there payable by way of remuneration was a percentage on the net profits and this, it is argued for the assessee Company, distinguishes that decision

holdings.reasoning_summary: Rejects distinction attempt; Sassoon principle on accrual timing (debt creation at end of year) directly applicable.

holdings.text: Income accrues when assessee acquires right to receive: must be debt owed (debitum in presenti, solvendum in futuro).

anchor.surface_text: It is clear therefore that income may accrue to an assessee without the actual receipt of the same. If the assessee acquires a right to receive the income, the income can be said to have accrued to him though it may be received

holdings.reasoning_summary: Applies established test from Sassoon and English cases: no debt/right on each sale, only at year-end.

holdings.text: Unnecessary to consider distinction between right to receive payment and creation of debt, or reconsider Sassoon.

anchor.surface_text: It has been argued before us that the decision requires reconsideration because it failed to make a further distinction, a distinction which it is stated arises in law, between the right to receive payment and the creation

holdings.reasoning_summary: On facts, no debt/right arose per sale; issue not arising.

holdings.text: Not considering validity of protective or precautionary assessments on Nemani group.

anchor.surface_text: We are not considering in this case the validity or otherwise of what are known as protective or precautionary assessments, and nothing said in this judgment has any bearing on that question.

holdings.reasoning_summary: No bearing on contract construction; Department to refund if double-taxed.

holdings.text: Questions whether managing agency is service, requires full year service, or apportionment permissible do not fall for decision.

anchor.surface_text: We were also addressed at some length on the further question whether managing agency is service and if so, whether it must be for one full year or whether apportionment is permissible. These questions do not fall

holdings.reasoning_summary: Proceeded on footing managing agency is business per Lakshminarayan; accrual decided on that basis.

holdings.text: Proceeded on footing that managing agency work constituted business per Lakshminarayan Ram Gopal.

anchor.surface_text: We have proceeded in this case on the footing that the managing agency work of the assessee Company constituted business within the rule of the decision in Lakshminarayan Ram Gopal and Sons Ltd. v. The Government of Hyderabad

holdings.reasoning_summary: Assumed for accrual decision; not deciding service nature.

precedents.citation: E. D.Sassoon and Company Ltd. v. Commissioner of Income-tax, Bombay City  1

anchor.surface_text: E. D.Sassoon and Company Ltd. v. Commissioner of Income-tax, Bombay City  1 . With reference to the argument of learned companynsel for the assessee Company that the companymission was payable on the sale proceeds and number on the profits as in Sassoons case  1 , it said We would have given serious thought to this aspect of the matter but for the view we take that the decision of the Supreme Court with regard to the question of creation of the debt and with regard to the serving by the managing agents for a term of one year being a companydition precedent for their being entitled to receive payment, is indistinguishable on the facts of this case.

precedents.case_name: E. D.Sassoon and Company Ltd. v. Commissioner of Income-tax, Bombay City
precedents.cited_proposition: Managing agency commission accrues at the end of the financial year when it becomes due after serving the full term, as no debt is created until then and right to payment is conditional on full year service
precedents.cited_holding: Unless and until there is created in favour of the assessee a debt due by somebody it cannot be said that he had acquired a right to receive the income or that income has accrued to him.

precedents.citation: W. S. Try Ltd. v. Johnson 1

anchor.surface_text: W. S. Try Ltd. v. Johnson 1  and Webb v. Stenton  2 . Unless and until there is created in favour of the assessee a debt due by somebody it cannot be said that he had acquired a right to receive the income or that income has accrued to him.

precedents.case_name: W. S. Try Ltd. v. Johnson
precedents.cited_proposition: Income accrual requires creation of a debt: debitum in presenti, solvendum in futuro

anchor.surface_text: Webb v. Stenton  2 . Unless and until there is created in favour of the assessee a debt due by somebody it cannot be said that he had acquired a right to receive the income or that income has accrued to him. It has been argued before us that the decision requires reconsideration because it failed to make a further distinction, a distinction which it is stated arises in law, between the right to receive payment and the creation of a debt.

precedents.cited_proposition: Income accrual requires creation of a debt: debitum in presenti, solvendum in futuro

Gardner Mountain DAmbrumenil Ltd.  4 , on which learned companynsel for the appellant placed reliance, the facts were quite different and on a true companystruction of the agreements there, it was held that the companymission payable under certain under-writers agreements arose in the year in which the policies were underwritten.

precedents.case_name: Lakshminarayan Ram Gopal and Sons Ltd. v. The Government of Hyderabad

precedents.citation: Commissioners of Inland Revenue v. Gardner Mountain DAmbrumenil Ltd.  4

Gardner Mountain DAmbrumenil Ltd.  4 , on which learned companynsel for the appellant placed reliance, the facts were quite different and on a true companystruction of the agreements there, it was held that the companymission payable under certain under-writers agreements arose in the year in which the policies were underwritten. That decision proceeded on a companystruction of the agreements there companysidered and it is numberauthority for companystruing other agreements of a different character.

precedents.case_name: Commissioners of Inland Revenue v. Gardner Mountain DAmbrumenil Ltd.
precedents.cited_proposition: Commission payable under underwriters agreements arises in the year policies are underwritten

precedents.cited_proposition: Income embedded in sale proceeds of each transaction accrues on each sale
